headline: CNN This Morning
subHeadline: GOP Debate Without Trump; Marshall Mirarchi Is Interviewed About Biden's Dog; Gilgo Beach Suspect In Court Today. Aired 8:30-9a ET

utterances.speaker: PHIL MATTINGLY, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: Again, I understand the policy and the issues here, but the politics of this, particularly in this subset, under workers that I think both parties have been fighting over. You ran in 2020. You know how this works. Do you think that it resonates -- do you think it's a problem for the administration?

utterances.speaker: PETE BUTTIGIEG, TRANSPORTATION SECRETARY
utterances.sentences: Well, this is another example of creating or contributing to a problem and then trying to play politics with it.Look, this technology is happening. It is coming. It is coming no matter what. The problem is that China was able to build an advantage during the Trump administration because the last administration didn't take the steps that were needed in order to make sure that that EV revolution was American led. We're taking a different approach. We're recognizing that these technologies are coming, that there's no going back to the old technology, that you're not going to be the leading economy in the world depending on strategies from the '60s and '70s. Into the 2020s, '30s, '40s, '50s we've got to make sure that we build the advantage on electric vehicles and have the policies to back that up. The question is not whether cars are going to become increasingly electric. The question is whether those EVs are going to be made in America or whether they're going to be made in China. We are working to make sure they're made in America.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: All right, Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg, appreciate your time, sir. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: BUTTIGIEG
utterances.sentences: Thank you. Good to be with you.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: Poppy.

utterances.speaker: POPPY HARLOW, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: All right, Phil, thank you.What happens when former President Donald Trump tries to court union workers? We're about to find out.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Look at that beautiful New York City this morning.Well, just into CNN, also happening in New York City, New Jersey Senator Bob Menendez has arrived at a federal courthouse downtown, alongside his wife. This is the embattled senator's first court appearance stemming from federal charges related to bribery. Twenty- six of Menendez's fellow Democratic senators have now called on him to resign.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: Well, we'll keep watching that.But also this morning, former President Donald Trump headed to Michigan later today to speak with an audience, around 500 former or current union members, at a non-union plant out of Detroit. Something UAW President Shawn Fain finds, quote, pathetic. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: SHAWN FAIN, PRESIDENT, UNITED AUTO WORKERS
utterances.sentences: I find a pathetic irony that the former president is going to hold a rally for union members at a non-union business. And, you know, all you have to do is look at his track record.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: You know, to that point, Trump made a lot of promises to autoworkers during his first campaign. For example, in 2016, he said this in Warren, Michigan.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) DONALD TRUMP, FORMER U.S. PRESIDENT: If I'm elected, you won't lose one plant. You'll have plants coming into this country. You're going to have jobs again. You won't lose one plant, I promise you that. I promise you that. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: That's the promise. In 2018 GM announced it would end production in five facilities in North America, including in Michigan. HARLOW(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) DONALD TRUMP, FORMER U.S. PRESIDENT: And I was -- I was looking at some of those big once incredible job-producing factories. And my wife, Melania, said, what happened? I said, those jobs have left Ohio. They're all come back. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: They didn't. Two years later, that Lordstown auto plant shut down. It was one of the largest employers for workers in that entire area.And autoworkers union president Shawn Fain pointed out during a short strike against GM in 2019, Trump and Republicans largely stayed on the sidelines. All of that will likely coming up at the debate tonight that Trump is skipping. A chance for the other Republican candidates to try to make their case to voters. Let's talk about what's ahead. CNN chief national affairs analyst, anchor of "EARLY START," Kasie Hunt, is with us, CNN's senior political commentator, former senior advisor to President Obama, David Axelrod. It's great to have you guys here. Axe, you have an new op-ed on cnn.com where you quote, of course, Yogi Barra.

utterances.speaker: DAVID AXELROD, CNN SENIOR POLITICAL COMMENTATOR
utterances.sentences: Got to.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You got to.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: It's honestly the most important part of that piece.

utterances.speaker: AXELROD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: You don't even need to read the rest, for me.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Did you just read the first line, Mattingly?

utterances.speaker: AXELROD
utterances.sentences: A font of wisdom.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: You're supposed to read all of Axe's stuff?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You -

utterances.speaker: AXELROD
utterances.sentences: I wrote it for Phil.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You quote him in describing the shadows that engulfed the left field at Yankees Stadium in the afternoon as saying, quote, it gets late early out there. Why did you invoke that?

utterances.speaker: AXELROD
utterances.sentences: Because I think it's getting late early for the other Republican candidates for president. You know, some thought that when Donald Trump was indicted the first time that he would lose ground. He gained ground. The second, third, and fourth time. He has what is an almost historically large lead. And someone needs to break out here as the principle alternative to Trump or you're gong to see a repeat of what we saw in 2016 where the opponents divide up some of the vote and he romps to the nomination.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: Well, Kasie, to that point, this is a space that I know you operate in as well. When you talk to donors, they're, a, both very aware of this, but, b, don't really have an answer here, right? They're - they're - they're using this debate as kind of a decisionmaker for a lot of them but have no concept of whether or not they can actually help winnow the field. So, how does this end?

utterances.speaker: KASIE HUNT, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: Yes, no, I mean as David Axelrod knows very well, the donors are a fickle bunch and they don't always necessarily have the best political judgment, which I know strategists like him spend a lot of time thinking about and working on.

utterances.speaker: AXELROD
utterances.sentences: You think they'd hear (ph) it, Kasie.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: David, what do you think?

utterances.speaker: AXELROD
utterances.sentences: Well, look, I agree with everything that Kasie has said. Somebody has to break through. DeSantis, I think, is under tremendous pressure tonight because his whole campaign was predicated on that. He was that guy. He was the alternative. You remember a year ago, or a little less than a year ago, he was the flavor of the fall and he was the guy who was going to take Trump. And he's done nothing but lose ground since.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I mean do you remember the "New York Post," "defuture"?

utterances.speaker: AXELROD
utterances.sentences: Yes. I mean he was the - he was the candidate of the Murdoch empire.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: AXELROD
utterances.sentences: And he has faltered. So, this debate is particularly critical for him.Nikki Haley did very well in the last debate and the desperate donors who Kasie refers to are now shifting their attention to her. Maybe she's the one who can do it. But, you know, with success comes greater scrutiny. And she's going to get some attention, I suspect, on that debate stage tonight from some of the opponents as well who are taking note of her progress.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: Kasie, I make a point of never asking you about Michigan -

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Really?

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: Because your preferences on that issue are awful generally.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Why ever would that be?

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: But I'm fascinated by the 24-hour period of Biden there at the picket line, Trump there at a non-union shop but making the play for the same group. How do you think this games out, because this is a micro battle in what is becoming a macro rematch.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Right. No, I mean they're both - you know, Biden and Trump are running general election strategies right now. And, obviously, Trump still does have - does have a primary.First of all, go blue. I'm just going to get that out of the way, Phil.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: Can you cut her mic?

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: But, look, I -- Republicans also are not used to -- I mean all -- Democrats are extremely careful to always hold their events at union shops, right? That's because, honestly, this is built into the DNA of the party. And that's still the reality.However, Trump did made pretty unusual inroads with rank and file union voters across what, you know, we kind of refer to as the blue wall. And that's the wall that put Biden in the White House in 2020 and that cracked in 2016 for Democrats and led Hillary ultimately to lose, Hillary Clinton to lose that election. And she, of course, lost in Michigan. And, you know, I actually covered both Democratic and Republican campaigns there and I was in these union halls and they were - honestly, a lot of them were Bernie voters first and Trump voters second. And that is the phenomenon that Trump is trying to continue to exploit. And, you know, he does have a better chance than almost any other Republican candidate of doing that. But he does also have a record now, and he didn't in 2016. And you pointed out some of the ways he was inconsistent here. I think there may be, especially in Michigan, some people who remember that.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: So just to put a button on it, the fact that promise that jobs are coming back, they did not come back. The Lordstown plants closed.

utterances.speaker: AXELROD
utterances.sentences: Yes, videotape is inconvenient. But Trump has managed to elude accountability for so many things. And we'll see if that is held against him. It's a brilliant move on his part to go there tonight and counter program against the debate because what he's saying is, that race is over, this race is on, and he - he did force Biden's hand.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: To go.

utterances.speaker: AXELROD
utterances.sentences: Biden, I think, went to Detroit in part because Trump was coming today. So, you know, four indictments, trials ahead, but he's still the guy who's kind of setting the scene.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: David Axelrod, thank you.

utterances.speaker: AXELROD
utterances.sentences: Good to see you guys.Kasie Hunt, thanks so much.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: Thanks, guys.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Thanks, guys.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Be sure to watch Kasie every morning, of course, and check out David's new op-ed we just talked about on cnn.com.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: Yogi Barra.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yogi Barra.

utterances.speaker: AXELROD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: President Biden's German shepherd biting again. Commander bit another Secret Service agent. His 11th bite so far that we know of. [08A former Secret Service officer, retired Secret Service K-9, Hurricane, see, we get the pup to join us too, next. (COMMERCIAL BREAK)

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: So, this developing overnight. CNN has learned the president's dog, Commander, bit another Secret Service agent. This time it happened at the White House on Monday night. It is the 11th known time that the two-year-old German shepherd has bitten someone. It comes after another of Biden's dogs, Major, was sent away from the White House after at least two biting incidents.Let's talk about this with former Secret Service Officer Marshall Mirarchi. He worked with the tactical K-9 unit and is - Marshall is with, we should introduce your special guest, obviously, retired Secret Service K-9 Hurricane, whom he takes care of now. Thanks for being here.

utterances.speaker: MARSHALL MIRARCHI, FORMER SECRET SERVICE SPECIAL OPERATIONS OFFICER
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Eleven times is a lot. Is this normal?

utterances.speaker: MIRARCHI
utterances.sentences: So, this amount of bites I guess would not be normal. It is normal for a dog to be acting out in an environment like that at the White House. You know, thousands of people walking around. Just the sheer size of the place. You know, not getting that comfort feeling that the dog gets.But, yes, at this point, you know, I think, obviously, something needs to be done just to make sure that Secret Service agents, as well as, you know, White House staff can, you know, feel safe going to work and not have to worry about that.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: It's -- I think it's a great point because, one, there's a - there's a significant staff. It's not just Secret Service. There's household staff throughout the course of the West Wing and the White House generally. But what can be done? Because I naturally side with the dog, always, because dogs are amazing. But what is the option here? Because he's been through training before after past incidents.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Well, before you go, I want to hear about the good you have done now along with your pup. Hurricane Heroes, what is it?

utterances.speaker: MIRARCHI
utterances.sentences: So, we started a 501(c)(3) after Hurricane retired that covers medical bills for police, military, law enforcement K-9s when they retired to make sure that they can live happy lives like this guy in retirement.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Love that.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: He also has a great Instagram account that people should check out and he's just doing great on cam. Like, I just kind of want to go hang out with him right now.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Wait, aren't you getting a dog soon?

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: Stop.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Are your children watching?

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: Stop.Marshall, this is great.

utterances.speaker: MIRARCHI
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: It's fantastic. We appreciate it. Thanks, Marshall, so much for your expertise. And, Hurricane, love you, man.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: MIRARCHI
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Of course.Turning the page here. Within the hour, the suspect in the Gilgo Beach murders will be in court. We'll tell you what to expect. That's next. (COMMERCIAL BREAK)

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: Well, this morning, the suspect in the Gilgo Beach killings is expected to appear in court for a status hearing. Prosecutors and defense attorneys will discuss evidence disclosure and provide updates. You remember Rex Heuermann was charged with murdering three women whose bodies were found dumped along Gilgo Beach more than a decade ago. He's pleaded not guilty to all charges.CNN's Jean Casarez is live for us in Riverhead, New York, outside the courthouse with more. Jean, what might we learn about the evidence considered today?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I'm so glad people look at their faces now and you read their names because this is about justice for them and their families.Jean, thank you. We'll continue to follow it very much. Thank you for joining us. Come back tomorrow after we stay up all night and watch the debate.

utterances.speaker: MATTINGLY
utterances.sentences: Watch the debate. We'll break it all down and a lot more.
